Policies

  • Students may attempt the quiz 3 times.
  • Each student's highest attempt will be counted as their score.
  • There is no time limit for this quiz.
  • Students will be able to save their progress and return to the quiz later after starting.

  • 3 ) The Moon's angular diameter in our sky is measured to be half a degree. From this, we can find the

    The Moon's angular diameter in our sky is measured to be half a degree. From this, we can find the
    • bulk density of the Moon (the average number of kilograms per cubic meter of Moon material).
    • distance to the Moon even if we have no other information about the Moon.
    • diameter of the Moon in kilometers even if we have no other information about the Moon.
    • diameter of the Moon in kilometers if we know the Moon's distance.

    Which one of the following statements about angle is correct?
    • 50 arcseconds is half of a degree.
    • 50 arcminutes is half of a degree.
    • 30 arcminutes is half of a degree.
    • 30 arcseconds is half of a degree.
